intro: Colpodium hedbergii, commonly known as the Hawaiian sea rocket, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other mustard plants. The plant is characterized by its erect, branched stems and small, green, ovate leaves. Its flowers are typically yellow or white, arranged in clusters, and it produces small, capsule-like fruits. Colpodium hedbergii thrives in coastal habitats and is adapted to the unique environmental conditions of Hawaii.
